values:
why is it that within a week of saying "i love you" laure is dating another guy?
(her other exs step brother, with 3 moms)       - dude who broke us up for spending all their time on Diablo II, but was "just a friend" -

im still living here for fuck sakes.
for breaking up to have space, this is a bold move.
i guess im not getting break up / move out sex anymore...

must suppress urge to kick ass...
must suppress urge to kick ass...
must suppress urge to kick ass...

people say hello and goodbye, right? Good morning, goodnight?

its basic ettiquette, no?

People dont just vanish to bed or work or wherever they are going do they? 

dont even online people say goodnight or tell the other person they are leaving?


it seems really strange i have to "force" it. 
somehow me expecting these things is wrong.

Why do people insist on being consumed by their text msgs/ online chat? Why do they not understand that people in person are more important than dude on the computer?

dont you hate that? 
they get lost in their private texts and your left ignored for the most part. 

Its fucking rude.

So, Im moving in with Laure. Im gonna sublet my place and put the money in her pocket. ive been squating for the better part of 2 months though, providing a necessity for her until recently (during the bus strike). so its pay rent time. I practically live there already. hopefully a 2 bedroom apartment opens up and i can have a music room again.

so apparently im not THAT good...I tried, but gave in for the most part.


anyways, she just left whats his name and is with me now so things are better.

oh yeah, my les paul got broken (crushed the neck) by my drunk roommate. FUN TIMES.

Livejournal. the place to work out our problems we do want facebook friends to see because its about them.
No idea who checks this still (I dont) but advice is welcome.

Met a girl, named Laure.  (6ft, black hair, artsy)

She has a boyfriend of 3 years she lives with, but she says only with him until she finds another place. (whenever that is)
she  doesnt even tell her parents about him or sleep with him anymore (so she says) so i dont know real a couple really  they are.

I think we naturally like eachother but other stuff gets in the way.  I know shes above anyone else ive seen or met, at least for what i want.  I find myself holding back though even though  we act more like were a couple, than friends.

She spent the night here  (I let her have my bed and took  the floor) watching Dr. horrible over 5 times and singing along.  it took so much not to give in to her.   I should have friday night when we were all over each other physically. 
Now its starting to get the longer i hold off the more we get used to this censored attraction which will fade to just a good friendship.

I figure my options are:
1. say screw it next time a situation arises and be the other man. ( still not sure how i feel about being that)
2. get her to leave him so she can be with me.
3. stay friends and continue to move on with the others i've met here (though i dont want to settle for someone else)

I met the other guy who is a VERY LARGE guy. like a grizzly who'd maul me with one hand in 5 seconds or less.

every few years i write a song in standard tuning. that time has arrived again (007 + Ours + matt good-weapon). then i though to myself, you know what i else i  haven't done in years? (or what feels like) Livejournal.

so here i am.

I know i always say recording soon....and never show anything....but this time i have a reason.
I was gonna start a while ago but in doing research plus Humbers recording engineer giving me a few private lessons, I found my recording equipment was junk and it was surprising i got as far as i did with it.
So i spent months more doing research of what to get and spent $5000 (college money) or so a laptop setup. Still waiting on protools 8 to be shipped to me though. crazy backorders since its january release. 
im going to Fanshawe in the fall for all this recording stuff so its good to get familier with the industrys tools now.
so, once that ariives ill be up and at it again. meanwhile ive still been writing but not recording.


I hope you guys are doing well. not sure who comes back to pickering at all but if you do we should catch up.
Things are getting pretty lame around here recently. Friendships that once were stong have been wavering of late. I really actually Want to go to school and get gone. and i mean classes school, not frat party school.      Although...

Wow, I"m on this making a post? I think hell froze over. i swear i saw some snow today too....

My last post from whenever long ago said i finished my album  but have yet to record it. Not much has changed other than a few new songs swapped for some other new ones. Gonna try singing but no promises I'll share if it blows.

NOW is recording time at last! In 2 weeks we'll see what i have done, and how much i spent on timmys XL doubledouble's.

Hopefully something that will get me into Fanshawe for next Fall...Anyone in London?

Ok, so After a long hiatus, and then recording 3 songs this week I have a full album planned with all the rough demos recorded.  
Now i need to rerecord all of them, perfectly.

i took a look at the local port hope paper from today and read 3 articles.

one about a girls murder, the second about a crack house and people being charged, and third about a guy who touched children.

FUCKKKKKKKKK

im really drunk right now.
I met a girl at a bar in port hope but i forget her name and never got her number because the bar she went into i got thrown out of. fuckkkkkkkkkkk

and her mom was wasted and was like "sleep with my sexy daughtr.....fuck. 

fvuck!!

I dont know if anyone uses this anymore but i thought  id mention i have a new Email address. 

Averymartin@hotmail.com
The band called it quits this weekend after 2 years.

Apparently an 18 year old girl moved in 2 houses away from me....
thats all i know right now but i'll investigate.
I got an Ipod and have spent the last Entire week loading my Cd's onto  it and im still only 2/3 the way in. It Sucks balls because i have to type all the artist and song names in myself.

STEP FUNCTION
Friday April 6th, @ the kathedral (toronto)
8:30 set time.

tickets are $20 which includes a bus ride to and back from the show and a copy of the brand new 4 song demo

we should have a few college shows sometime soon to.

God damn. I just saw the most hilarious commercial. it was people camping in a forest fire, a guy washing his car when the streets were flooded, a people walking there dog in a hurricane...then it said ignoring global warming wont stop it. ... .... they do know that the verdict on IF global warming actually existes is still out and let alone that it will cause all this disaster which it wouldnt. nobody ever mention the positives about it either. (less driving accidents during winter for one)

what they SHOULD do, is actually let the science be shown. Countless of scientests including my uncle say its phooey. i dont know if your aware but what the liberal media does is if a study doesnt support there view they wont print it. and thats not saying the stuff they fabricate and fuss about.
- there is no proof second hand smoke has any effect.
- did you know all the same people who fuss about global warming were fussing about global cooling just in the 70's?
- who said global warming is man made? ever heard of the ice age? when we were coverd in a mile of ice? climates change 

god damn i hate those misguided hippies.

see, the non burnt out non retarded hippies want what? personal freedom, to stick it to the man. right?
the man = government = laws.
what that means is they (and I, and should us all) want is less government interferance in our day to day lives. this boils down to the right to choice.
many commom issues now are about taking away freedom. sadly, though they think they are helping people they are just relincwishing our personal freedoms.

- do parents not know what is best for there own kid then some government official?
- should a business not have the right to decide what they pay employees? (if you dont like it then quit)
- should a church or other private group who doesnt accept gays because of there beliefs be forced to accept them?
- should a persons sexual orientation or race give someone a job over a more qualified person?
- same with it for not getting them a job.

as you can imagine there a many many more i could say. give me a topic and i'll say what i think if you wish.

so whats the deal with all these people who think they know whats better for me then i do?

ok, im kind of getting suckered in by hockey but a few other points i wanted to get of my chest were:
- left side = more government/more laws/less freedom
- right side = less government
- to the notion that poor people are better, or have more charecter; who do you think gives to charities? are the well off the ones stealing and breaking into houeses? and whats the poverty like here anyway? over 95% of canadians have a car, a tv, a computer, food, clothes, a house and anything regarded as essential. what about when my grandma had to drop out of school at grade 7 to work in a factory just so the family had food. and she wore plastic bags on her feet as shoes. I have no problem with giving to the poor though, we do. i just dont like when its taken from me instead.
- NAZI stands for national socialst party of germany. that is on the left. please dont group them with the wrong side.
- Trudeau sucked ass. you know he made that giant debt were paying? and that he refused the bill that would have allowed us to own our property so things like that pickering airport incident where they just took peoples homes wouldnt be possible? he sure is my hero.
- Unions are in general, shit. www.freethelivelyseven.org
-Universites used to teach you how to think. Now its what to think. were you aware in i believe it was ryerson that a student brought in a toronto sun paper with him a the prof blew up and threw him out of class because he didnt buy the star? he sure had freedom didnt he.
- I hate that new Hannah girl on much music. I hated the old one too. She got angry at leonardo dicaprio for financially adopting a kid! i dont see her doing bugger all so a big routen touten FUCK YOU! to her. he does something good and gets ragged on. and im sure if he did take her away with him they'd a;; make a fuss like they did madonna.

anyways, i could go on but im sure you've quite had enough. its nothing against the people here (other than that hannah girl and that prof). I have no doubts that they arnt nice people or anything like that. just to be clear.

if you have any interst in these topics i suggest the western standard.

New Deftones is Fucking wicked!
i just had to say that first off.

I have 299 cds now (only full artist albums, no compilations or soundtracks). looking forward to getting the 300th.

the band is going great, despite our loss at a battle of the bands to a band who couldnt tune their guitars but brought all there mommies and daddies to vote for them. How bands with 0 talent but sold x number of tickets can move on over our band who is in honest to god better than many signed bands. that being said, were really working on our career. we go into the studio early into the new year to record a professional demo. a new site should be up in the near future.  

www.stepfunction.ca  

Dec 7th we play ep taylors as a headliner. i know that will be a good show. were going to play some new material that will blow them away.I dont know it it'll be ready by then but the band is getting a 6 ft x 6 ft drop cloth for behind us.

I have a new car since my corolla died. im not going to tell you what it is. your gonna have to see for yourselves.

hehe, we ordered mcdonalds then hot boxed it when the guy gave us our food julian leaned out and said " a hey hey hey, smoke weed everyday!"     <---hint

oh, i quit teaching guitar too.

oh hey, its been a while so here's an update. first, new computer so my shit works again.
so friday im driving into pickering and the transmission of the corrola goes. i was stuck going home in first gear which is 40kmh. then today im heading into band in  the impala and the same fucking thing happens. it dropped so i could go 90kmh max. so now its 1 car for 4 of us at the moment.
in other news i've taken to smoking pot daily for the past3 weeks maybe so far. im high now. i got a nice new pipe with 3 bowls and its got a nice case thats all purple velvet inside. all 4 of my little ones broke. I really feel like getting really drunk at a party. i havent been drunk in a long time, just kinda tipsy when i've drank.

BAND
the 26th stepfunction had a show at ep taylors which is the durham college pub and we fucking killed that place. it was adams debut and our first time whipping out some new material and all went well. we didnt really bring many people and the whole place was up at the stage going crazy. we got called for an encore! the headliners were pissed that they had to follow us. hehehe,  it was a halloween show so i put on those rediculously tight glittery star pants that belonged to steph. there are pics somewhere. 
the demo is being played on the durham college radio station i believe and were talking about being the headliners for a pantera/dimebag tribute show there.  
we just entered a internation battle of the bands too. we have our first heat in november. its a thing where half the bands go on until its international. who knows, if we keep winning we can be playing a huge festival in germany...if we win. the give away prizes at the shows for best guitarest and drummer so we have a good chance there.  the prizes are as much as a new guitar or new drum kit depending on which show # it is.

Roy craig, julians dad and the band are in talks of him being our manager. and not in a hes a parent way. were talking contracts and him fronting money like $3000 so we can record at a professional studio and get a press kit togather. hire photographers, write bios, get us press and gigs, all the good stuff.


FENILON FALLS
this was a weird series of events. it was supposed to be on the saturday but last minute on the thursday before the town shut the show down for all this stupid shit so the show was moved to bobcaygon on the sunday. warren was on the news at 6 and 11, 3rd story in and his segment was 3 minutes long. his story was in the papers and apparently it even got picked up on the radio in fredricton! but alas nobody came. now warren is in debt id bet a good $5000 to erics (40 year old drummer guys) mother. 

works good, when im there. i have 3 students...total of an hour and a half a week. but 2 of them at least are wanting to learn and a freshly new to music.

thats about it for the moment.

So many of you have been asking who Chris Perneroski is, so here is his story; Chris Perneroski's dream was to race professionally for the Canadian Motor Cross but unfortunately, he suffered a tragic accident before this was possible. Not only does Chris need special attention to help him with everyday activities but also depends on a liquid diet that is given intravenously. Chris's cognitive functioning is very limited, as he has suffered both primary and secondary brain damage from a very traumatic impact to the head. The end result left him unable to speak, immobile, only to move with help and is dependant on a wheelchair, leaving him with a limited quality of life. We at The Everyday Musician believe it is our party to give back and so we are raising funds to help with the huge cost of renovating the house and amenities that are required, so that Chris may lead a comfortable life.

In other news im 20 now and single again (free!). So much better.
I got this crazy friggen chair. i'll post pics when i can but its amazing. 
The band recorded a new song with Adam, our new singer and it turned out pretty damn sweet. he's got a much more scott weiland style.

So I passed over some details about the concert in my last post. Truth Is I met a girl, we hit it off  and ended up off into the bushes. anyways Her names Jessica. only thing is shes from hamilton. :S  Its cool though. Shes 18 (1988), at highschool for an extra year, is full on into art, and a red head...  last night we decided were gonna try the long distance thing so its official. i like driving and she'll take the bus if she can.  there are so many good things that i cant even mention here. its just effortless.
does anyone else watch bpm:tv? I've been enjoying it immensly of late.

the one thing in the world I want the most right now is winter. Im so excited for it. Falls almost here and i love fall too so this is awesome.  I cant wait until the leaves start changing and i get to wear sweaters and see people in scarves. I feel like running outside and throwing leaves and then Snowboarding.  I want to teach my 5 year old daughter whos cute as hell to ice skate. it would be night and we'd have lights up over the ice. our cheeks would be all red from the cold nipping at us. I know i dont even have a daughter but thats just what i want to do. 
I want to take my mittens off to drink hot chocolate and have a burger at a nice little diner. 

I want to walk around york with a tims cappachino at 11am like i used to. i'd have breach of trust on my headphones and just go exploring around. I want to wear my touqe and my coat. 

I havent been myself lately i dont think. I've been thinking a lot about things and what i want and theres 2 contrasting views that i've always had. I dont think i've had one in balance for a little while.  I think i've fixed that tonight. I hope so.

I  may have come to realize that i want to move to connecticut someday. or at least somewhere in that new england area. Its like the great vally for the dinosaurs in the land before time for me. everything about it just screams home.   

also, i dont care who knows it I watch and love gilmore girls. I own 5 seasons on dvd and will buy the 6th when it comes it out. I also bought more pants and am a size 3.

http://www.teaparty-online.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=3696

Jeff gets more crazy everyday.


I've come to realize lately that i find myself idolizing him less and less. dont get me wrong i still like his stuff but its not the stuff i want to do at all anymore. I've been more into Jeff Buckley as my main influence recently
This was one of the longest, lamest days i've had in a long time.

wow, i havent been online in forever. I dont have too much to say.  just that im going to the Family Values tour tomorrow. im gonna see korn deftones andsome other bands. a pile of us are going. It'll be a blast for sure.

And for those of you who dont know I've Started  Seeing an Amber.

Things are Good.
the september 2nd show is now october 29th

Everybody book off work or whatever you have on the weekend of september second. I have a show with step funtcion in fenlin falls and you all need to be there. Warrens putting on the show so i know all about what to expect and let me say, it sounds crazy.  

now, its $30 each to get in but it'll be worth it by the sound of things 

There was a guy who was one of the top 10 moto crossers in canada and he got in an accident and now is in a wheelchair and what not. The family now needs to put ramps and all that stuff  up in there house and this is event is a fundrasier for it. 
Its going to be an all day private party on there huge property. We need 250 people to come to break even apparently. There of course will be a bunch of other bands and show stuff like guys doing moto cross tricks. It is also incouraged to bring a tent to camp out and then leave in the morning.

Its not a 19 plus event but it is...so any of you underagers can still come. I believe its byob, but i still have to check. Lots more details to come.




you have to come.

Big Shiny Tunes 2 is one of the best albums i've ever heard. I just put it on again and it blew my socks off. Every singe one of those songs are Gold (minus track 13) . If you have it put it on and you'll see just how good it was/is. if you dont have it, shame on you.

Now on the list of things to do in my lifetime

- hear Jeff Martin cover a Kate Bush song.

 


Hell, if he doesnt i will.
I Martin, vow to sometime in my lifetime cover a kate bush song the way i hear it in my head.

and It'll be a ballad

so I've had the album Transmission for over 8 years now, and my Triton keyboard for over 5. yet today was the first time I ever tried to play songs from that album. I figured out Temptation, gyroscope, alarum, and Transmission. Its friggen sweet. I plugged in to an amp and put distortion on a strings pad and it turned out awesome. I cant wait to fool around more with these sounds. I think some kicking new step function songs will result from this.

Step Function is now the name of the band and these are the members. 
 - Julian: drums
 - Jamie: guitar
 - Phil: Vocals
 - Evan: bass
 - Martin: keyboards

We recorded a 4 song demo last weekend and it turned out fucking killer. We gave it to Universal music and they said they like it but want a different mix with more bass and bass drum. Otherwise everythings cool with it otherwise. 
We rocked dunbarton high school today too. We fucking ripped that shit apart. man, fuck. we were in the middle of a circle of like 300 people or more all bodysurfing and rocking out. and seriously, more than half of that school is hot girls. we got 2 full pages of phone ###s and other contact info. fucking Phil, Jamie and I were packing up our shit and this one MINT!! girl comes up to us and is all like "nice show" and we were like "thanks, want an autograph?". so she give us her arm and we told we wernt going to sign there and she fucking pushes her tits out of her shirt for us. We didnt have a sharpy though so i havent signed a pair of breasts...yet. We had another girl willing to get her breasts signed too later on. Consensis is we need to invest in some band sharpies for tit signing.

after we went and flyered the mall and talked to lots more hot slutty girls (no guys or ugly fat chicks were flyer worthy) 

SERIOUS though, MAY 26th SHOW IN AJAX!!!

so i was busy digging out all the ash from my fire mound to make it a pit again when my dad comes out with the phone.
I talked to Jim at legend music and i got a job teaching guitar weekdays from about 3 - 9pm and saturday at 10:30am - 4:30pm. 
I dont start until the end of may sometime because im a replacement for Ross who is going to BC to be a hippie and go wherever life takes him. And yes, Ross was the one who played guitar before i joined Reverie.
Anyways, i didnt even apply or mention wanting a job. Jim just called and offered it to me. I think it must have been the rest of the guys (Warren, Krista, kyle, Chris, and Ross) who said to hire me. Oh, and best of all I get paid ($15-$20hr.) to play guitar.
Also, i'll be in town every night and free after 9pm to hang out and chill all summer.

Long & McQuade is proud to present "An Afternoon with Exile and the Kingdom" featuring Jeff Martin. This special event, brought to you by KOCH Records and Erikson Music, will include "East Meets West" - a percussion clinic featuring Michael Lee on drums and Ritesh Das on tabla, an "Alternate Guitar Tuning Symposium" featuring Jeff Martin, as well as live performances and a meet and greet with Jeff Martin and his band. 

Michael Lee is a world famous drummer who has played with a number of well known bands. His resume includes ZZ Top, Aerosmith, Bon Jovi, Bryan Adams, Guns 'N' Roses, the Cult, Lenny Kravitz, Thin Lizzy, and Echo and the Bunnymen. He was invited by Robert Plant to be part of the "Fate of Nations" World Tour which eventually led to the development of Page & Plant. Most recently Michael Lee has been touring with Jeff Martin and played drums on Jeff's new solo album, Exile and the Kingdom. 

Ritesh Das, composer and musician, has studied tabla with gurus Pandit Shankar Ghosh, Ustad Zakir Hussain, and most extensively with Pandit Swapan Chaudhuri. He has toured throughout the US, Canada and India, and performed with many of India's great music and dance innovators. Since moving to Canada, he has established himself as an extraordinary teacher of tabla and founded the Toronto Tabla Ensemble in 1991. 

After fifteen years of the Tea Party, former front man, Jeff Martin, decided it was time for a change - so he left to pursue a solo career. Jeff Martin is a guitarist, vocalist and producer. He has produced albums for Roy Harper (The Green Man), Hundred Mile House (self-titled EP), The Jay Murphy Band (Propaganda) and Tenth Planet (The Prophet Curse EP.) Jeff quit the Tea Party in October 2005 to pursue a solo career. His new album is called Exile And The Kingdom. 

To register for this clinic email our Mississauga store with your contact information. Please note that this is not a seat reservation. It gives us a means of contacting you should the date, time or location of this clinic change. Seating is on a first come first served basis. 


Date: Thursday, April 27th, 2006, 4-8pm 
Location: Long & McQuade (900 Rathburn Rd. W., Mississauga. ON) 
Fee: Free 

WHO wants to come with me?
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

 
I also say them in concert at the phoenix last night and it was effing awesome. SOOOOO good.  Im dragging at least some of you to the june or july shows. 
I met them all last night and got my ticket signed. Jeff and i had a conversation about our danelectro guitars. (he bought his about 4 years ago too so i dont know who had one first)
He also mentioned that all of the tea partys guitars are tied up in legal matters so he cant use any of them...which should give you an idea of how the break up is going.

Give me 10 seconds of your time and just take a look here.

Because i went shopping yesterday. 
I bought (generic stuff first) 
* Rammstein - rosenrot 
* Lacuna Coil - karma code (which strangly has a cover of depeche modes enjoy the silence) 
* depeche mode - Catching up with ... 
* Foo Fighters - Colour and the shape 
* The cure - Head on the door 
* Bjork - Dancer in the dark soundtrack 
* Dancer in the dark dvd 
* Emma on dvd (ewan mcgregor) 

and now the reasons im happy 
* The serpents kiss on dvd which i've been trying to find for months. its got ewan mcgregor and charlie boorman (the guy i met who went around the world with ewan on motercycles) 
* PLUS!! 
* PLUS!!!!!!! 

JEFF MARTIN SOLO CD!!!! EXILE AND THE KINGDOM! 
Its the only thing i've used that i bought. 
SOOOO good. $9.99 at future shop i think...or $12.99. 
I think you'd like it. 

If you've ever heard me say i want to record a folk style album it would be like this. 
If you hear the world is calling, its by far the worst on the cd. 
Im sure you'll all hear this record in my car many times. 

I also got tickets to see him at the on the 24th of april.

http://www.myspace.com/faredayeffect

Go here now.

This is marcs band that i just finished recording yesterday. we still have one more song to go but 2 are up now.

In other news, I saw Jeff martin at Healys in toronto on wednesday. It was sweet. I was insanely close. I saw him and said good job (or something to that effect) and he said thanks as he was walking by and being swarmed by a mob. I didnt swarm because its got to be hard to deal with that. He came back out to the bar later and got swarmed again so i didnt get to meet him really. I saw him for a 3rd time walking down the street as i was driving home. seriously, the man is tall. he's definitly 6 something. The top of my head reached his shoulders. I could see his head easily about the crowd when he was being swarmed.
Sadly though, it was only him jamming with some guys for a few songs. I was hoping to see his new band in action and hear some new stuff but it was still good by any means. He'll be back twice in april. one in toronto and one in guelph if need be for sold out ticket reasons.

I have made the greatest discovery since sliced bread. 
I took my Tv and DVD player (PS2) out to the warehouse and proceeded to work while watching movies and getting drunk. 

...So i got paid $12 an hour for 7 hours...to work while watching movies and drinking. 

I repeat. I got paid $12 and hour for 7 hours to work while watching movies and drinking. 


HOW DID I NEVER THINK OF THIS BEFORE!!!!!

so its done.
I've just played 3 shows in 2 days at the showcase theatre in peteburough. in total it was over 1000 people, with tonights being over 500 which was almost a full house.
It was an awesome time playing to a large crowd with an actual light show and sound engineer in an established venue which has hosted many popular artists such as teri clark, wave, and mr. Dress-up as well as a pile of musicals. hanging out back stage and having our own dressing room was cool as well, not to mention the free food a beer over 2 days.
and i didnt ever have butterflies or any nervousness what so ever. I was also told my stage presence is strong and really good. apparently i was a stand out.
Its not a time i'll likely forget.
